t: God’s Final Word in His Son
God,*p after He spoke long ago to the fathers in the prophets in many portions and in many ways,
in these last days has spoken to us in His Son, whom He appointed heir of all things, through whom also He made the world.

And He is the radiance of His glory and the exact representation of His nature, and upholds all things by the word of His power. When He had made purification of sins, He sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high,
having become as much better than the angels, as He has inherited a more excellent name than they.

For*p to which of the angels did He ever say, “You*spn are*s My*s Son,*s Today*sln I have*s begotten*s You”?*s And*p again, “I*pn will*s be*s a*s Father*s to*s Him*s And*ln He*s shall*s be*s a*s Son*s to*s Me”?*s
And*p when He again brings the firstborn into the world, He says, “And*pn let*s all*s the*s angels*s of*s God*s worship*s Him.”*s
And*p of the angels He says, “Who*spn makes*s His*s angels*s winds,*s And*ln His*s ministers*s a*s flame*s of*s fire.”*s
But*p of the Son He*i says,*i “Your*spn throne,*s O God,*s is*s forever*s and*s ever,*s And*ln the*s righteous*s scepter*s is*s the*s scepter*s of*s His*s kingdom.*s
You*sln have*s loved*s righteousness*s and*s hated*s lawlessness;*s Therefore*sln God,*s Your*s God,*s has*s anointed*s You*s With*sln the*s oil*s of*s gladness*s above*s Your*s companions.”*s
And,*p “You,*spn Lord,*s in*s the*s beginning*s laid*s the*s foundation*s of*s the*s earth,*s And*ln the*s heavens*s are*s the*s works*s of*s Your*s hands;*s
They*sln will*s perish,*s but*s You*s remain;*s And*ln they*s all*s will*s become*s old*s like*s a*s garment,*s

And*ln like*s a*s mantle*s You*s will*s roll*s them*s up;*s Like*sln a*s garment*s they*s will*s also*s be*s changed.*s But*sln You*s are*s the*s same,*s And*ln Your*s years*s will*s not*s come*s to*s an*s end.”*s
But*p to which of the angels has He ever said, “Sit*spn at*s My*s right*s hand,*s Until*sln I make*s Your*s enemies*s A*ln footstool*s for*s Your*s feet”?*s
Are*p they not all ministering spirits, sent out to render service for the sake of those who will inherit salvation?
